title: Replace homepage video fallback with newly uploaded office image

requirements.text: Replace the Home page VideoSection fallback image (served at public URL `/assets/video-fallback.jpeg`) with the newly uploaded image (`image-1.png`) so that when the video cannot be loaded, the site displays this new image instead of the previously used office image.

quotes: replace into office image i sent you eariler

acceptanceCriteria: The frontend contains a static asset at `frontend/public/assets/video-fallback.jpeg` whose content matches the newly uploaded `image-1.png` (converted/renamed as needed).
When `/assets/watch-our-video.mp4` fails to load, `frontend/src/components/site/VideoSection.tsx` continues to render `` and the displayed image is the newly uploaded one.
The public URL used by the site for the fallback image remains exactly `/assets/video-fallback.jpeg` (no route changes and no backend involvement).
No changes are made to the Internet Identity/auth hooks or other immutable frontend paths.

constraints: Keep the fallback image URL/path used by `VideoSection` exactly `/assets/video-fallback.jpeg` to avoid breaking existing behavior and documentation.
Do not introduce new routes or change existing navigation.
nonGoals: Changing the video embed behavior, video file location, or adding new media/gallery sections.
Updating marketing copy or other page content unrelated to the fallback image swap.
Backend changes (not required for this asset replacement).
